dt: {bc}to be the home or habitat of

dt.t: a town that {wi}harbors{/wi} several textile factories

dt: {bc}to hold especially persistently in the mind {bc}{sx|cherish||}
{bc}to take shelter in or as if in a harbor

et: Middle English {it}herberwen, herborewen{/it} "to lodge, give shelter to," going back to Old English {it}herebeorgian,{/it} going back to Germanic {it}*haribergōjan-{/it} (whence also Middle Dutch {it}herbergen{/it} "to provide shelter for," Old High German {it}heribergōn{/it} "to set up quarters for an army, stay as a guest," Old Norse {it}herbergja{/it} "to shelter [a person], lodge"), derivative of {it}*haribergō-{/it} "shelter for an armed force" {ma}{mat|harbor:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to give shelter or refuge to
to be the home or habitat of; broadly : contain
to hold especially persistently in the mind : cherish
